snippet.textDisplay: Great review! I like how you tempered expectations (good, not great). Being a souls-like is such a double-edged sword: it gets on your radar, but you're also compared to Elden Ring, so instantly set up for disappointment. It's a lot of fun in co-op but ya need measured expectation!
snippet.textOriginal: Great review! I like how you tempered expectations (good, not great). Being a souls-like is such a double-edged sword: it gets on your radar, but you're also compared to Elden Ring, so instantly set up for disappointment. It's a lot of fun in co-op but ya need measured expectation!

I will be looking forward to and supporting.

snippet.textDisplay:
I bought the game when it came out and I was soo excited, from what I saw... I abandoned it about half way through, I was disappointed...
I picked it up again a few days ago, when I heard of the remake. I gave it another try... and it was amazing, I love this game ‚ù§
I'm almost finished, already level over 100, the bloody glory is one of the craziest weapons I've ever seen in a souls like. Seeing the devs put soo much love and effort into a game, almost that alone makes it better!
I'm definitely playing it again, trying other builds 
Yeah 9/10 ‚ù§

snippet.textDisplay:
Played the game when it released, dropped it in the first 5 minutes, played it again during 1.6 and i barely finished it but it was a slog. 
Even if they fixed the combat a bit on 2.0 im sure they didnt fix the world, because navigating in this game is impossible. Huge areas with 55 layers stacked on top of each other that looks exactly the same. They included the shadow realm world which changes the areas you can reach and things you can interact with on top of all that mess.
I got lost in this game many times. I even needed to watch a video about a beacon that i could not find and guess what, it was a whole main area that i missed. This doesnt happen in any other soulslike games and especially in soulsborne.

It felt like they threw every possible shit that they could on the wall. Hopefully they can keep only those that stick if they make LOF 3

snippet.textDisplay:
Redownloaded this after quitting after a couple of hours first time around. This time its clicked for me for some reason, weapon sounds are much better, feels like theres weight behind them and feels like you're actually doing damage. The dedicated jump button is ok but you only jump a few inches off the floor lol
Enjoying it so far, have beaten 4 bosses (excluding the tutorial boss) so not bad from someone who's pretty shite at souls like games but will always play them lol
Will say people need to give this game a bash if they haven't yet. Good time to jump in with this update.

First souls game I actually am trying and holy fuck it‚Äôs amazing. But damn souls games are really hard huh? I just got done beating the first girl boss I forgot her name some type of demon or angel, red wings. So after I beat her with the help of ok rod those bulky dudes I run into a pregnant flying lady who‚Äôs spawns those zombie things (forgive me I know NO names) yet‚Ä¶

What got me into this game is the fact that it‚Äôs hard. KCD 1-2 being my first ever rpg games and found this pretty difficult to learn then mastered it and it was easy, but see I had 2 weeks off from work so I had the time to beat two rpg games back to back. Now that I‚Äôm back at work I just wanna play this shit! But I can‚Äôt put all my time into it anymore lol I miss being a child. If I were 12 I‚Äôd play this 24/7 even skip meals and showers smh

snippet.textDisplay:
Two years of straight updates making game improvements, Multiple overhauled systems, Literally free to play if you have a friend with the game, Devs banned from the LOTF subreddit for updating body type A&B to male/female. The updated movement does actually feel good. There's lots of comparisons to elden ring here but keep in mind, elden ring features massive arenas and an open world. LOTF is more closed in spaces. The movement feels smooth to me for the world you are moving around in. The attack animations and updated sounds are also fantastic. 

People need to take this game for what it is. It has the bones of a souls game and looks fantastic. Boss difficulty is harder than DS1&2, but not quite near elden ring. You will not find a Malenia fight here. This can be simplified depending on your build. For example if you choose to summon NPC for every boss and use a shield, your experience will be different than someone solo fighting bosses with dual daggers and light armor. The combat overall is a bit heavier feeling in LOTF while elden ring is fast and snappy. All this is to say that $20 is an absolute steal for this game. For people like me who adore fromsoft games, there's no reason you can't also enjoy other products such as Lies of P and LOTF. Seriously give these games a try.
snippet.textOriginal:
Two years of straight updates making game improvements, Multiple overhauled systems, Literally free to play if you have a friend with the game, Devs banned from the LOTF subreddit for updating body type A&B to male/female. The updated movement does actually feel good. There's lots of comparisons to elden ring here but keep in mind, elden ring features massive arenas and an open world. LOTF is more closed in spaces. The movement feels smooth to me for the world you are moving around in. The attack animations and updated sounds are also fantastic. 

People need to take this game for what it is. It has the bones of a souls game and looks fantastic. Boss difficulty is harder than DS1&2, but not quite near elden ring. You will not find a Malenia fight here. This can be simplified depending on your build. For example if you choose to summon NPC for every boss and use a shield, your experience will be different than someone solo fighting bosses with dual daggers and light armor. The combat overall is a bit heavier feeling in LOTF while elden ring is fast and snappy. All this is to say that $20 is an absolute steal for this game. For people like me who adore fromsoft games, there's no reason you can't also enjoy other products such as Lies of P and LOTF. Seriously give these games a try.
